de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface MaterialDialogDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnimateableDialog, ButtonBarDialog, HeaderDialog, ListDialog, MaterialDialog, ValidateableDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnimateableDialog, AbstractButtonBarDialog, AbstractHeaderDialog, AbstractHeaderDialogFragment, AbstractListDialog, AbstractMaterialDialog, AbstractMaterialDialogFragment, AbstractValidateableDialog, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, ProgressDialog, WizardDialog

    public interface MaterialDialogDecorator
extends Dialog
    Defines the interface a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        Dialog.Gravity

    • Field Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        getContext

    • Method Detail

      • getWindowBackground

        android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getWindowBackground()
        Returns the background of the dialog's window.
        Returns:
        The background of the dialog's window as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no window background is set

      • setWindowBackground

        void setWindowBackground(@DrawableRes
                         int resourceId)
        Sets the background of the dialog's window. Preferably, it should be a 9-patch drawable using the color white for visible areas and transparency for invisible ones. This allows to customize the shape of the dialog as well as its shadow. The window background is only used if the dialog is not shown fullscreen. The drawable's padding is taken into account for insetting the dialog's content (see getWindowInsetLeft(), getWindowInsetTop(), getWindowInsetRight() and getWindowInsetBottom()).
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the window background, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid drawable resource

      • setWindowBackground

        void setWindowBackground(@Nullable
                         android.graphics.Bitmap windowBackground)
        Sets the background of the dialog's window. The given bitmap is stretched to fit the dialog's width and height. Therefore, if the width and height is not explicitly given, the method setWindowBackground(int) should be preferred. If the given bitmap is null, a rectangle, which matches the width and height of the dialog, is used as the window background.
        Parameters:
        windowBackground - The window background, which should be set, as an instance of the class Bitmap or null, if no window background should be set

      • getWindowInsetLeft

        int getWindowInsetLeft()
        Returns the left inset of the dialog's content, depending on the padding of the dialog's window background. If the dialog is shown fullscreen, the inset is always 0.
        Returns:
        The left inset of the dialog's content in pixels as an Integer value

      • getWindowInsetTop

        int getWindowInsetTop()
        Returns the top inset of the dialog's content, depending on the padding of the dialog's window background. If the dialog is shown fullscreen, the inset is always 0.
        Returns:
        The top inset of the dialog's content in pixels as an Integer value

      • getWindowInsetRight

        int getWindowInsetRight()
        Returns the right inset of the dialog's content, depending on the padding of the dialog's window background. If the dialog is shown fullscreen, the inset is always 0.
        Returns:
        The right inset of the dialog's content in pixels as an Integer value

      • getWindowInsetBottom

        int getWindowInsetBottom()
        Returns the bottom inset of the dialog's content, depending on the padding of the dialog's window background. If the dialog is shown fullscreen, the inset is always 0.
        Returns:
        The bottom inset of the dialog's content in pixels as an Integer value

      • isCanceledOnTouchOutside

        boolean isCanceledOnTouchOutside()
        Returns, whether the dialog is canceled, when touched outside the window's bounds, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog is canceled, when touched outside the window, false otherwise

      • setCanceledOnTouchOutside

        void setCanceledOnTouchOutside(boolean canceledOnTouchOutside)
        Sets, whether the dialog is canceled, when touched outside the window's bounds. If set to true, the dialog is set to be cancelable, if not already set.
        Parameters:
        canceledOnTouchOutside - True, if the dialog should be canceled, when touched outside the window, false otherwise

      • isCancelable

        boolean isCancelable()
        Returns whether the dialog is cancelable with the BACK key, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog is cancelable, false otherwise

      • setCancelable

        void setCancelable(boolean cancelable)
        Sets whether the dialog is cancelable with the BACK key, or not.
        Parameters:
        cancelable - True, if the dialog should be cancelable, false otherwise

      • isFullscreen

        boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns, whether the dialog is shown fullscreen, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog is shown fullscreen, false otherwise

      • setFullscreen

        void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Sets, whether the dialog should be shown fullscreen, or not.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - True, if the dialog should be shown fullscreen, false otherwise

      • getGravity

        int getGravity()
        Returns the gravity of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The gravity of the dialog as an Integer values. The gravity consists of the flags given in Dialog.Gravity

      • setGravity

        void setGravity(int gravity)
        Sets the gravity of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        gravity - The gravity, which should be set, as an Integer value. The gravity must consist of the flags given in Dialog.Gravity

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The width of the dialog in pixels as an Integer value or Dialog.MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog.WRAP_CONTENT

      • setWidth

        void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        width - The width, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The width must be at least 1 or Dialog.MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog.WRAP_CONTENT

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The height of the dialog in pixels as an Integer value or Dialog.MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog.WRAP_CONTENT

      • setHeight

        void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        height - The height, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The width must be at least 1 or Dialog.MATCH_PARENT, respectively Dialog.WRAP_CONTENT

      • getMaxWidth

        int getMaxWidth()
        Returns the maximum width of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The maximum width of the dialog in pixels as an Integer value or -1, if no maximum width is set

      • setMaxWidth

        void setMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Sets the maximum width of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - The maximum width, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum width must be at least 1, or -1, if no maximum width should be set

      • getMaxHeight

        int getMaxHeight()
        Returns the maximum height of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The maximum height of the dialog in pixels as an Integer value or -1, if no maximum height is set

        Sets the maximum height of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        maxHeight - The maximum height, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The maximum height must be at least 1, or -1, if no maximum height should be set

      • setMargin

        void setMargin(int left,
               int top,
               int right,
               int bottom)
        Sets the margin of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        left - The left margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The left margin must be at least 0
        top - The top margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The top margin must be at least 0
        right - The right margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The right margin must be at least 0
        bottom - The bottom margin, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The bottom margin must be at least 0

        int getPaddingRight()
        Returns the right padding of the dialog.
        Returns:

      • getPaddingBottom

        int getPaddingBottom()
        Returns the bottom padding of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The bottom padding of the dialog in pixels as an Integer value

      • setPadding

        void setPadding(int left,
                int top,
                int right,
                int bottom)
        Sets the padding of the dialog. The padding does not apply to the dialog's header and buttons.
        Parameters:
        left - The left padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The left padding must be at least 0
        top - The top padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The top padding must be at least 0
        right - The right padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The right padding must be at least 0
        bottom - The bottom padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The bottom padding must be at least 0

      • isFitsSystemWindowsLeft

        boolean isFitsSystemWindowsLeft()
        Returns, whether the dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the left edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog insets its content at the left edge, false otherwise

      • isFitsSystemWindowsTop

        boolean isFitsSystemWindowsTop()
        Returns, whether the dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the top edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog insets its content at the top edge, false otherwise

      • isFitsSystemWindowsRight

        boolean isFitsSystemWindowsRight()
        Returns, whether the dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the right edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog insets its content at the right edge, false otherwise

      • isFitsSystemWindowsBottom

        boolean isFitsSystemWindowsBottom()
        Returns, whether the dialog accounts for system screen decorations such as the status bar and insets its content at the bottom edge.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog insets its content at the bottom edge, false otherwise

      • setFitsSystemWindows

        void setFitsSystemWindows(boolean fitsSystemWindows)
        Sets, whether the dialog should account for system screen decorations such as the status bar and inset its content, or not.
        Parameters:
        fitsSystemWindows - True, if the dialog should inset its content, false otherwise

      • setFitsSystemWindows

        void setFitsSystemWindows(boolean left,
                          boolean top,
                          boolean right,
                          boolean bottom)
        Sets, whether the dialog should account for system screen decorations such as the status bar and inset its content, or not.
        Parameters:
        left - True, if the dialog should inset its content at the left edge, false otherwise
        top - True, if the dialog should inset its content at the top edge, false otherwise
        right - True, if the dialog should inset its content at the right edge, false otherwise
        bottom - True, if the dialog should inset its content at the bottom edge, false otherwise

      • getScrollableArea

        @NonNull
ScrollableArea getScrollableArea()
        Returns the scrollable area of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The scrollable area of the dialog as an instance of the class ScrollableArea. The scrollable area may not be null

      • setScrollableArea

        void setScrollableArea(@Nullable
                       ScrollableArea.Area area)
        Sets the area of the dialog, which should be scrollable.
        Parameters:
        area - The area, which should be set, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area or null, if no area should be scrollable

      • setScrollableArea

        void setScrollableArea(@Nullable
                       ScrollableArea.Area top,
                       @Nullable
                       ScrollableArea.Area bottom)
        Sets the areas of the dialog, which should be scrollable.
        Parameters:
        top - The top-most area, which should be scrollable, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area or null, if no area should be scrollable
        bottom - The bottom-most area, which should be scrollable, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area. If the top-most area is null, the bottom-most are must be null as well. The index of the bottom-most area must be at least the index of the top-most area

      • areDividersShownOnScroll

        boolean areDividersShownOnScroll()
        Returns, whether dividers, which are located above and below the dialog's scrollable areas, are shown, when being scrolled, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the dividers, which are located above and below the dialog's scrollable areas, are shown, when scrolling, false otherwise

      • showDividersOnScroll

        void showDividersOnScroll(boolean show)
        Sets, whether dividers, which are located above and below the dialog's scrollable areas, should be shown, when scrolled, or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True, if the dividers, which are located above and below the dialog's scrollable areas, should be shown, when scrolling, false otherwise

        Parameters:

        void setIconTint(int color)
        Sets the color, which should be used to tint the icon of the dialog.

                     android.content.res.ColorStateList tintList)
        Sets the color state list, which should be used to tint the icon of the dialog.
        Parameters:

      • getIconTintMode

        @NonNull
android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode getIconTintMode()
        Returns the mode, which is used to tint the icon of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The mode, which is used to tint the icon of the dialog, as a value of the enum PorterDuff.Mode. The mode may not be null

                     android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode mode)
        Sets the mode, which should be used to tint the icon of the dialog.
        Parameters:

      • getTitleColor

        int getTitleColor()
        Returns the color of the title of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the title of the dialog as an Integer value

      • setTitleColor

        void setTitleColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the title of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • getTitleTypeface

        @Nullable
android.graphics.Typeface getTitleTypeface()
        Returns the typeface of the title of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The typeface of the title of the dialog as an instance of the class Typeface or null, if the default typeface is used

      • setTitleTypeface

        void setTitleTypeface(@NonNull
                      android.graphics.Typeface typeface)
        Sets the typeface of the title of the dialog.

        Note, that the typeface is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the typeface.

        Parameters:
        typeface - The typeface, which should be set, as an instance of the class Typeface. The typeface may not be null

      • getMessageColor

        int getMessageColor()
        Returns the color of the message of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the message of the dialog as an Integer value

      • setMessageColor

        void setMessageColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the message of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • getMessageTypeface

        @Nullable
android.graphics.Typeface getMessageTypeface()
        Returns the typeface of the message of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The typeface of the message of the dialog as an instance of the class Typeface or null, if the default typeface is used

      • setMessageTypeface

        void setMessageTypeface(@NonNull
                        android.graphics.Typeface typeface)
        Sets the typeface of the message of the dialog.

        Note, that the typeface is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the typeface.

        Parameters:
        typeface - The typeface, which should be set, as an instance of the class Typeface. The typeface may not be null

      • getBackground
